thread.title: Why was Mets fan Jerry Seinfeld wearing a Chicago Cubs hat at Wrigley Field? (PHOTO)
thread.title_full: Why was Mets fan Jerry Seinfeld wearing a Chicago Cubs hat at Wrigley Field? (PHOTO)

author: Charles Curtis | For NJ Advance Media
title: Why was Mets fan Jerry Seinfeld wearing a Chicago Cubs hat at Wrigley Field? (PHOTO)
text:
You've seen the tweets, in-booth appearances and on-camera cheering for the Mets from Jerry Seinfeld. 
So why in the name of Newman would he be wearing a Chicago Cubs hat back in 2008 while at Wrigley Field? 
Here's why we ask: @Chicago_History unearthed this photo: Who you fooling Seinfeld? pic.twitter.com/NmJgSeV5xK â€” Chicago History (@Chicago_History) October 19, 2015 
So is that just Bizarro Jerry who lives in Chicago? Nope. Here's the answer from the Chicago Tribune : "The hat 'was given to him by the Cubs on a visit to Wrigley. Worn once,' Seinfeld's publicist Tom Keaney said in an email to the Tribune." 
There you go. As you were, Internet. 
Follow Charles Curtis on Twitter @charlescurtis82 . Find NJ.com on Facebook
